description:
Hello First Year Engineers! Have you ever wondered, what a Mining Engineer actually does? Do you know about the numerous career paths you could choose from as a Mining Engineer? The variety of topics and skills you could learn while studying Mining Engineering at UBC?

You might have got some information about our Department through our APSC 100 presentation. But we know that 10 mins isn’t enough for addressing all the questions you may have or all that you want to learn about what we do.

So, come join the World’s 14th Best Mining Engineering Department in an event that is being hosted by students and highly renowned industry professionals just to answer all your questions. 

▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀

WHAT: Learn about Mining Engineering at UBC
WHEN: March 9th, 2017, 6-8 PM
WHERE: Engineering Student Center
RSVP: https://goo.gl/forms/tRSesOu4eebiiQbk2 

▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀

This event will have short keynotes from:
✔️Current Student: Describing the undergraduate experience and teams you can be a part of.
✔️Professor: Outlining why we are one of the top 15 schools in the world. 
✔️Young Alumni: Talking about their exciting new experiences in the industry.
✔️Experienced Alumni: Demonstrating their successful career in mining.

▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀

RSVP TODAY! 
Don’t miss out this amazing opportunity, attendance is limited with only 100 spots. Make sure to invite your friends: https://goo.gl/forms/tRSesOu4eebiiQbk2 
 
▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀

Current Mining Student, Sign up to be a Mentor here: https://goo.gl/forms/paBKJlUiUtInuBpH3   

Alumni, Sign up to be a Mentor here:  https://goo.gl/forms/xzgfkQuvmdgW2Hxo2 

▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀
Any questions can be directed to Veronica Knott at vcaknott@gmail.com or Prakhar Tripathi at iprakhar@ymail.com

[Down] Sizing Your Life 

A discussion on living small through little lifestyles!

Come learn about ‘micro living’ as a sustainable housing option!

Join Emerging Green Builders at a documentary screening and conversation on downsizing your living spaces! 

The ‘Microtopia’ documentary, invites us on a number of micro living case studies throughout the world. It offers a new way of perceiving your living environment and the urban layout itself. 
The documentary screening will be followed by a discussion on micro and small-scale housing in our local context with B.C. Tiny House Collective. The conversation will introduce how to apply some leading principles in our own life!

Watch, chat with us and enjoy some snacks!

ŸÔ Org., Hugs are nice, Vancouver Helping Hands Foundation & Party Well are going GLOBAL with a simultaneous LiveStreamed Spread Love event!!! Join the Cause or Watch Live as the Power of Love is demonstrated in 3 seperate locations. <3

Las Vegas, NV Details: https://www.facebook.com/events/1833891676867383/

The Gado-Gado Indonesian Students Association ("GISAU"), in partnership with Simon Fraser University's Indonesian Association ("SFUIA"), Presents: Snow Jam 2017!

We're so excited to have you join us for GISAU's first ski & snowboard trip to Cypress Mountain. Here's a rundown of everything you'll be getting with Snow Jam:
- Date: Saturday, February 25
- Pick-up and drop-off at UBC or Downtown
- Lift tickets to Cypress Mountain
- Equipment rentals 
- FREE hands-on, ski/snowboard lessons from our Indonesian-speaking instructors 
- A bunch of Indomie (think Indomie Kari Ayam that you can never find in Vancouver!) and Awake Caffeinated Bars!

Join UBC Red Cross club for our conference ThinkHealth to learn about increasing accesses to health care and reducing health care inequality locally and globally. We will present you with a day filled with knowledgeable guest speakers and engaging workshops. 

Admission is $10 and will include refreshments, snacks, and lunch. All proceeds will go to UBC Red Cross' international appeal of access to healthcare! The conference set list of speakers and workshop's will be released at a later date! 

Please message us if you have any questions!

Join us for Cuts for Cancer 2017 on march 6th - the easiest way to look good and do good!

UBC’s Cuts for Cancer is an annual event in which students and the UBC community are given the unique opportunity to help those in the fight against cancer. Hair donations of 8″ or longer will be transformed into wigs for children who suffer long-term medical hair loss at BC Children’s Hospital, and funds raised from hair cuts are donated to the Canadian Cancer Society, where they will be put toward cancer research and treatments.

Cuts for Cancer is done with On The Fringe Hair Design, whose hairdressers donate their time and skill to deliver professional, top-notch haircuts to all participants!

Cuts for Cancer is UBC Cancer Association’s biggest event of the year, and we look forward to seeing all of you to come out and participate!

You can reserve your hair cut slot time ahead of time (Just make sure to arrive on time, or we may give away your spot)! But, you don't need to reserve ahead of time! We anticipate the majority of event-goers on the day-of to be walk-ins! Simply come up to our booth on the day of, and we'll get you a spot with one of the lovely On The Fringe hairdressers!
http://ubccac.com/2017/cuts-for-cancer/

event: Vow of Silence, Take the 24 Hr Pledge. UBC Free the Children.
description:
Up for a challenge? Try being silent for 24 hours! (No talk, no text... think you can handle it?)

Let your silence be the voice for thousands of children across the world that need your support. Your silence can be for any cause your are passionate about. On February 28th students across UBC will go silent for 24 hours. Join us in this movement! 

If you simply want to support that cause but cannot commit to the 24 hour pledge of silence (understable!), then still be sure to stop and think what is a cause that you are passionate about, try and also, stop by our booth in Woodward on Feb 28th and sign the banner/show ur support/maybe donate some change towards our project this year -  building schools in Sierra Leone to support higher quality education and providing libraries and administrative offices.

This event is not only for people who are interested in taking the 24hr pledge of silence, but also for those who simply want to show their support or learn more about the cause!

Ready to learn more about the local superstars in your community? The 8th annual conference, THE BRIEFING 2017 is finally here! 

UBC Dollar Project is proud to present our biggest event of the year celebrating the importance of charities and the global impact YOU as a single individual can make.

Attendees will have the chance to gain a greater insight on each presenting charity and will then have the chance to vote on one of the presenting charities to support. The catch? There is none! Just come for some good chatting and conversation about YWiB’s upcoming events. 

This event is first-come-first-serve. Open to members and non-members!

The University of British Columbia Debate Society invites you to attend the 2017 North American Women and Gender Minorities Debating Championships! 

This British Parliamentary tournament is open to non-male identifying competitors and judges from all institutions. Male participation will be allowed in the form of non-breaking panelists.

Registration
Registration will cost $80CAD for teams, and $40CAD for judges. We are able to provide this low fee due to grants and sponsorship we’ve received. If we are able to acquire more funding in the coming months, we will decrease registration and refund the relevant portion for those who have already paid – but please plan your contingents around this quote. 

To register your contingent, please email the following to nawdc2017@gmail.com:

1.	Name of institution
2.	Contact person’s name, email, and phone number
3.	Number of teams and names of debaters (and novice status, if applicable)
4.	Number of judges and names of judges (feel free to include their judging resumes!)
5.	Dietary restrictions of anyone in the contingent
6.	Billeting requests (if any)

We ask institutions to let us know as early as possible the number of teams and judges they plan on bringing (even just an estimate!), but the final registration deadline is March 10, 2017 at 11:59PM PST.

Adjudication
Our Chief Adjudicator is Kaja Marinic. Kaja broke twice at WUDC (Berlin, 2013 and Kuala Lumpur, 2015), and was a two-time quarterfinalist at NAUDC (2013, 2014), semifinalist at Hart House IV (2014), semifinalist at BP Championships (2012), and champion and finalist at multiple regional tournaments. She was also the Chief Adjudicator or co-Chief Adjudicator of: Canadian BP Championships (2016), Pacific Cup (2016), Western Canadian Championships (2015, 2012), Portland State University IV (2014), UBC IV (2014), Fall Open (2012), and SFU IV (2012), and was a two-time breaking judge at CP Nationals.

Our Canadian DCA is Kiana Saint-Macary. Kiana was the NAW*DC Novice champion (2015), Bilingual Nationals semifinalist (2015), Pan-Ams octofinalist (2016), Hart House IV semifinalist (2016), NAUDC quarterfinalist (2016), Guindon Cup champion (2016), Mac Pro-Am finalist (2016), and winner of the British Parliamentary Championships (2016). She was the top-three speaker at four of these tournaments as well. This year, she will be the CA for Canadian Parliamentary Nationals and Winter Carnival. Her additional judging experience includes Guindon Cup, Central Novice, and McGill’s many other tournaments.

Our American DCAs are Zoë Seaman-Grant, Camara Hudson, and Bexley Brown.

Zoë was a finalist this year at Dutch WUDC, partial double octofinalist at Malaysia WUDC, finalist at Yale IV (2016), semifinalist at USUDC (2015), finalist at NAWDC (2015), finalist at HWS IV (2016), finalist at Brandeis IV (2015, 2016), quarterfinalist at Hart House IV (2016), semifinalist at NorthAms (2015), quarterfinalist at Australs (2016). She was the top speaker of Yale IV (2016), second speaker of NAWDC (2015) and Brandeis IV (2016), third speaker of HWS IV (2016), and top-ten speaker at other tournaments including USUDC (2015), Brandeis IV (2015), and Hart House IV (2016). She has CA’d debates for Bates, and judged at Cambridge Women’s (2015), tournaments at Bates (2014, 2015), and at Australian Schools. 

Camara has been debating for 10 years, breaking to national and international tournaments. She was the top breaking team and quarterfinalist at Cambridge IV (2016), finalist at Cambridge Women’s (2016), quarterfinalist at HWS IV (2016), quarterfinalist at Hart House IV (2016), champion of Rochester IV, octofinalist of USUDC (2015, 2016), champion of US Northeast Regionals (2016), quarterfinalist of Pan-Ams (2016), octofinalist of USUDC (2015), and has broken and won several other tournaments. She has CA experience from Bard IV (2015), and the Huber Debates (2016). Camara has also judged finals for Cornell IV (2016), US Novice Nationals (2016), Cambridge Women’s (2015), and the Huber Debates (2014, 2015).

Bexley broke at several tournaments from 2011-2014 as a debater, and has judged at 18 tournaments in the past two years, including outrounds of Hart House IV (2016), NAUDC (2016), USUDC (2016), Pan-Ams (2016), Budapest Open (2016), and Brandeix IV (2016). She was also an IA for Dutch WUDC, Brandeis IV (2016), and the HWS Round Robin, and a DCA for BSDT (2015, 2016), and British Parliamentary Championships (2016). 

Judging
We request that each contingent bring n/2 judges to the tournament, but there will be no uncovered judging fee to ensure accessibility to all institutions. 
We have budgeted money to fund Independent Adjudicators. Selection of IAs will be done by the Adjudication Team, considering factors including regional representation and debating/judging achievements. Currently, we guarantee to fund at least 5 IAs, subsidizing a portion of their travel costs and giving free reg + billeting. The deadline for IA applications is January 15, 2017. 
If we are able to secure more funding, however, we have a second deadline of February 12, 2017. After this deadline, we will have a second round of funding allocation (contingent on the IA budget). Applicants who applied before the first deadline will continue to be considered if they did not receive funding in the first allocation. 
To apply, please email nawdc2017@gmail.com with:
1.	Your top 5 debating and/or judging accomplishments
2.	An estimate of how much funding you would need in order to attend.

Food and Socials
We will be providing breakfast, lunch, and dinner on Saturday, and breakfast and lunch on Sunday. We are happy to accommodate all dietary needs – please submit your dietary restrictions before the registration deadline!
Socials will be fun, inclusive, and reflective of the goals of this tournament! More details to come.

Accommodations
We hope to secure a discount rate at a hotel close to campus – more information will be released in the coming weeks!
If you require crash/billeting, please let us know as soon as possible the numbers of spots requested. We will make an effort to provide billeting to all who request it, and letting us know as early as possible makes it more likely that we will be able to accommodate you.

Schedule
Friday, March 17th, 2017:
Social TBA for early arrivals

Saturday, March 18th, 2017:
8:00AM – 8:45AM: Coffee, breakfast, and registration
8:45AM: Hard team drop
9:00AM: Briefings
9:45AM: Round 1
11:30AM: Round 2
12:45PM: Lunch
1:30PM: Round 3
3:15PM: Round 4
6:30PM: Banquet
Social TBA

Sunday, March 19th, 2017:
9:00AM – 9:45AM: Coffee, breakfast, and registration
9:45AM: Hard team drop
10AM: Round 5
12:00PM: Lunch/Women’s Forum
2:00PM: Open Semifinal and Novice Final
3:45PM: Open Finals
5:15PM: Awards

If you have any questions/comments/concerns at all, please feel free to email us at nawdc2017@gmail.com!

event: Fewer Left Behind x CSA - Exploring China’s forgotten generation
description:
Do you ever have moments in life when you miss being a child? You had nothing to worry about because you knew your parents were always there for you. In China, however, there are 61 million children growing up without one or both of their parents. That’s almost double the population of Canada living without one or both parents. How did this happen? What can we do to help?

JOIN US on February 8th at UBC for a night of exploration via documentaries, photography and a panel discussion. 

6pm | Registration & Photo Exhibit
-	Converse with students and individuals from all corners of the community interested in this tragic phenomenon. Witness a photo exhibit showcasing works of award-winning photographers such as Fan Li (李泛), Jesse Ding (小野杰西) and Jiang Nengjie (蒋能杰) capturing the plight of these forgotten children.

6:30-8:30pm | Screening and Panel Discussion 
-	Learn more about left-behind children by watching two documentaries by two award-winning filmmaker and journalists. When I Grow Up by Jiang Nengjie (蒋能杰), and Generation Left Behind by Matthew Carney.
-	Participate in a discussion and Q&A on the social impact of this issue and how the rest of the world can help. Panelists include experts from Asian studies, international relations, psychology, and child development.

Confirmed panelists:
Donna Seto, PhD (expert in children in conflicts, UBC), Yushu Zhu (expert in Chinese urban communities, UBC) and Marlyn Chisholm (representative, OneSky & economist, Chisholm Consulting)

For more information on this issue, visit: https://www.fewerleftbehind.org 


***NEW Date: Thursday, March 9th, 2017
Time: 6:00 – 8:30 pm 
Place: UBC Asian Centre
Dress Code: Semi-Formal 

These forgotten children may have no parents, but let’s make sure that they have a voice. Please come to support this cause.

FREE entry 
Reserve your free seat NOW! ⬇⬇
https://www.picatic.com/fewerleftbehind




JOIN THE CSA FAM:

event: CBV Information Session presented by CICBV
description:
Chartered Business Valuators (CBVs) are recognized experts who can quantify the worth of all, or part, of a business or its securities. They are experts who determine the value of tangible and intangible assets, including brand and intellectual property, and provide an easily understood explanation of the analysis. A CBV designation can provide you with competitive advantages and business opportunities.

You have the chance to break away from a crowded world of financial designations. And standing out brings rewards far beyond compensation. The skills you learn on your journey will be in demand. Every valuation and litigation engagement process is different, so every day is different. You’ll meet and work with leaders in every business category and walk of life. That’s the certainty of choosing CBV.

To learn more, please visit: cicbv.ca/become-a-cbv

A short informational video explaining the designation can be viewed or downloaded here: https://www.dropbox.com/sh/7k3pn3arhr86hev/AABu5BPprvCkZjps0Eipc2fJa?dl=0

The UBC Arts Undergraduate Society is proud to present the launch of our new service, HAUSpitality - AUS Health & Wellbeing!

event: [POSTPONED] UBCMA X PepsiCo Presents: Sales Night
description:
ANNOUNCEMENT: Sales Night has been postponed until further notice. 

What is the Sales Industry exactly? Is it really more than aggressive door-to-door marketing, sleazy deals, and hustling to get customers? 

At Sales Night, you will be able to learn about what the Sales Industry really is--how it builds true connection through exceptional customer service, and how it can ignite your entrepreneurial and creativity skills. 

PepsiCo, one of the market leaders in the food and beverage industry, will be leading the Sales Night workshops to teach you the secrets of their Sales Industry that led to their success. 

The night will consist of three interactive workshops on a rotational basis. The topics are:
➢ PepsiCo Beverage Large Format Sales & Better Together Opportunities
➢ PepsiCo Beverage Small Format Sales & Selling Strategies
➢ PepsiCo Foods Retail Sales & Product Knowledge

Not only will you be able to network with professionals from PepsiCo, one of the largest companies in the world, Sales Night will be the perfect opportunity for you to get ahead for UBCMA's upcoming PepsiCo Sales Case Competition, The PepsiCo Pitch!

+ DETAILS:
WHEN: Thursday, February 16th 5:30 - 8:00 PM
WHERE: TBA
DRESS CODE: Business Casual
PRICE: FREE for members, $10 for non-members
FOOD: Light snacks and beverages provided!

Buy your membership ($10) at the door, or online at: http://marketingassociation.rezgo.com/

Questions? Coming late? Message us on Facebook, or send us an email at helloubcma@gmail.com!

This event is open to students in all years, pursuing any option and in any faculty.

#UBCMA

description:
[*NOW OVER 40% SOLD OUT*] 

UBC Real Estate Club presents the very first Alumni Night at One Under Vancouver! 

We are bringing together over 100 students and UBC alumni from a variety of real estate career streams: development, finance, investments, brokerage, consulting, property management, and more. 

One Under is an urban golf simulation club in Downtown Vancouver. Golf is BIG in this industry, so what better opportunity to learn about the success of our alumni while brushing up on your golf skills? 

Awesome raffle prizes to be drawn throughout the evening.. See you there!

http://oneunder.ca/

(No experience necessary.)

FOOD AND DRINK TICKETS PROVIDED.

☆ DATE: Tuesday, February 28
☆ TIME: 5:30pm - 8:00pm 
☆ LOCATION: One Under (476 Granville St.)

☆ COST: $5.00 for members, $10.00 for non-members 

REGISTER HERE: https://studentalumninight.eventbrite.ca

Not a member yet? Pick up our $5.00 membership at www.ubcrealestateclub.com/#membership for exclusive access to member privileges.

event: Join the 2018 SLC Planning Committee: Apply Now!
description:
Applications to join the 2018 UBC SLC Planning Committee are now open!

Do you want to be part of one of the largest student-run conferences in Canada? Do you want to help create an amazing conference complete with inspiring speakers and workshops? Do you want to develop your own skills as a leader? If so, apply now!

We have the following positions available:
- Co-Chairs: Lead the conference by overseeing the Directors and Coordinators.
- Directors: Lead a particular portfolio of Coordinators and assist the Co-Chairs with planning the conference.
- Coordinators: Help Directors by completing tasks specific to their portfolio.

To apply, check out our website: https://students.ubc.ca/planning-committee

Co-Chair & Director application deadline: Jan. 27, 2017
Coordinator application deadline: Feb. 24, 2017

If you have any questions about the positions available, we invite you to attend our hiring event on Jan. 19 from 5:30-6:30pm in ANGU 243!

event: AMS Events Presents: The 10th Annual Block Party
description:
The AMS Block Party celebrates its 10th anniversary – this is the one you surely don't want to miss!

An event by UBC students, for UBC students and the campus community. It is intended as a safe and festive event that will bring students and friends together in a celebration of a year completed, and a summer soon to start.

We hooked up everything you know and love about the end of classes: 
 ϟ Seven hours of music & revelry 
 ϟ Food carts 
 ϟ Crazy fun games 
 ϟ You and 6000 of your friends!

TICKETS ON SALE TUESDAY, FEBRUARY 14TH AT NOON
ONLINE purchase available only. Credit and Visa debit accepted. Cash sales will be occurring later.

Super Early Bird $20 
Early Bird $25 
General Tier $35 
Final Tier $40 

ϟ There is a 1 ticket limit on Super Early Bird and Early Bird tickets.
ϟ ϟ There is a 2 tickets limit on General and Final Tier 

AMS Events would like to give a massive shout out to Blueprint University, a division of Blueprint, for their partnership with the AMS here at UBC.

ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ 

The 10th Annual AMS Block Party will be held at the Plaza outside the Nest
 ϟ  6133 University Blvd


Here's all the info for The AMS Block Party: 
When: Thursday April 6th (last day of classes!) 2:30 - 9:30 pm 
Where: The Plaza Outside the Nest
Tickets: $20 - $40 
19+ only 

ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ

Line-up: 

Keep checking in for the line up announcement. 

ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ

Block Party: A How-To Guide 
DO Bring: 
ϟ  2 pieces of Govt issued ID, at least one piece of ID with a picture. You must be 19 or older to enter Block Party 
ϟ  Your Ticket (your student card can act as your ticket if you used your student card to purchase your ticket) 
ϟ  Money. Drink tickets are $5 each. Calculate accordingly. 
ϟ  Actual clothing, real shoes. Hypothermia's not hot, no matter how skinny your jeans. 
ϟ  Empty water bottles for the refill station. Clear plastic only please. 
ϟ  A friend or two, look out for each other! 
ϟ  Plan a safe way to get home in advance 


Do Not Bring: 
ϟ   Umbrella. Poke your friends' eyes out some other day.
ϟ   Projectiles/Weaponry including pocket knives. Don't be that guy. 
ϟ   Sports equipment i.e. footballs, Frisbees, goats, etc.. 
ϟ   Any glass items. 
ϟ  Alcohol and other drinks/food from outside. 
ϟ  Chairs, loungers, couches, or pets. Seriously. 
ϟ  A Bag, if you can help it. You’ll get in faster if you don’t bring a bag (Entry is permissible upon bag check) 
ϟ  Yourself intoxicated. If you are intoxicated, we won't let you in. 
ϟ  Culturally inappropriate clothing - any clothing that belongs or is associated with a culture other than yours, any culture's clothing other than your own that you are wearing as a costume. 

This event will happen come rain come shine, your ticket is not refundable! 

There will be no in & outs allowed at the event; once you are in, you're in. 

This is a wheel chair accessible event. If you need additional accommodation, please contact us 72 hours prior to the event.

event: AMS Events Presents: ϟ Last Band Standing 2017 ϟ
description:
Are you ready for this? AMS Event’s Last Band Standing is back and better than ever! Fresh new bands show off their talent in a three-stage Battle of Bands competition with the ultimate prize of killer bragging rights. But most importantly an opening spot at Block Party 2017.

STAGE ONE: Band will first submit two original songs to enter (deadline is February 27th – 12pm, noon), the top 6-8 bands that make it through this stage will then have a music video filmed. This is filmed on March 1st and March 2nd so ALL band members must be available.

STAGE TWO: Is a week of fan-based voting, with up-to four bands being invited to participate in the live showdown. From March 8th - March 14th (at midnight!) 

STAGE THREE: March 16th - A panel of top-notch industry representatives will select the winning band! The band that wins the finale gains an impressive prize pack including: Video and Production by Coastal Motion, cash prize and an opener spot at Block Party 2017 and sooooo much more! 

Tickets to attend the event will be $5 in advance, sold from any AMS Events Rep, Coastal Motion Rep or online. Tickets will be $7 at the door. 

All money from this event will be going to Music Heals! For more information about the cause check out their website:http://www.musicheals.ca/

FINALE WILL BE ON MARCH 16TH
ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ ϟ 

Application deadline is February 25nd and can be found here: 
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1lFRxySSjtdZnGOh7N0UuDw10kcQxYTbJBI-uLRYsmzA/edit?ts=58a304e5 

For full rules and regulations please see: http://www.ams.ubc.ca/events/last-band-standing/rules-and-regulations/

GOOD LUCK!!!

LOVE THE SUPPORT!

Are you ready for one of UBC’s most iconic experiences? Swim, sprint, bike, run & STORM THE WALL! Participate as a Competitive or Just-for-Fun team, or challenge yourself to do the whole course on your own as an Iron Person. A fun & exciting UBC tradition!

Embrace Tradition. Embrace the Spirit. Embrace the Storm. #StormTheWall

▶ Event Format:
Teams of 5 compete in this UBC legacy event. Each person competes in a different leg of the relay before meeting at the walls to Storm the Wall together. Iron-people complete all the legs of the race on their own and Storm the Wall with the help of one other person.

Whether you take part in this legacy event or lose your voice cheering on your friends and peers, this is an event that you don’t want to miss. 

For questions or concerns please email storm.the.wall@ubc.ca

Registration is open until March 17! For more information, visit www.stormthewall.ca

Storm The Wall closing event day features:
- Special Olympics Heat
- Super Iron Woman & Iron Man
- Campus Wide and Division Finals
- The Wall Challenge

▶ Accessibility:
We will make adaptations and modifications to the best of our abilities to incorporate all individuals into our programs and events. Please reach contact us if you have any questions or concerns. Feel free to email: storm.the.wall@ubc.ca

▶ Volunteer with us:
Events like these would not take place without the enthusiasm and energy of students like you, who participate, but also the volunteers that make it run successfully. We are looking for a few extra hands to help during the event. If that interests you, feel free to fill out the volunteer form at:
recreation.ubc.ca/volunteer

Get your 2017 race season up and running with one of BC's largest and longest-running Triathlons. With a wide variety of distances - Olympic, Sprint, or Short - as well as a Duathlon, Relay, Kids/Youth Aquathlon and Kids 'Splash, Peddle and Dash', there really is something for everyone! The event takes place on the UBC Campus and surrounds, all entrants earn a medal and the prestige of starting the season off in style.
Professional race timing and an official TriBC sanctioned event.
Event Format Public, staff and student registration available for Olympic, Sprint,Short, Duathlon, Relay and Kids Aquathlon. Relay teams register 3 people, 2 needed to race. All start times are based on estimated swim times.
Find out more and register at:
recreation.ubc.ca/intramurals/events/ubc-tri-du/

▶︎ Volunteer with us:
Events like these would not take place without the enthusiasm and energy of students like you, who participate, but also the volunteers that make it run successfully. We are looking for a few extra hands to help during the event.

If that interests you, feel free to fill out the volunteer form at:
recreation.ubc.ca/volunteer

▶︎ Accessibility:
We are proud to incorporate all abilities and peoples into our programs and events, so please contact us if you have any questions or concerns. Feel free to email: ubc.triathlon@ubc.ca

It’s that time of year UBC. A night where art, music, paint, and hundreds of your friends come together at our largest flagship event of the year. 

On March 10th, the gorgeous Harbour Event Centre will play host to the wildest paint party in UBC’s history, as we transform the space into an interactive art show for the largest college party in Vancouver. Showcasing some of the best art, design, and talent, this night is focused on exploring your inner party spirit. Live painters will create breathtaking pieces of art before your very eyes while UV artists turn you into another piece at the gallery. 

Party your night away, as some of the very talented DJs from across Vancouver throw down your favorite house, trap, and top-40 remix that promise to keep you moving all night long. Backed by the largest LED screen in Vancouver, watch as CO2 cannons, trippy lasers, confetti, party totems and so much more will fill out your Blank Canvas experience, this night comes only once a year, so make it count! 

This is a night to book off work, assemble your crew, head off campus and create memories that will last long after the last drop of paint hits the floor. 

Make Art. See Art. Be Art

Friends from UBC, SFU, Vancouver and beyond, welcome to Blank Canvas!

██████████████████████████

F E A T U R E S 

✌ Live painting
✌ UV Bodypainting stations
✌ Super Soakers of UV Paint
✌ Custom painted UV Canvases

✌ Confetti

This event is 19+
Two pieces of government ID are required
Pat downs and coat checks at the door

Get ready. Get Stoked. 
✌ The Calendar ✌

event: 75% SOLD | Accelerating Impact: UBC Social Enterprise Conference
description:
It’s finally here: get ready for the 2017 UBC Social Enterprise Conference! 

This year, we bring you “Accelerating Impact: Scaling Solutions to Social Challenges.” 

We believe that social entrepreneurs will inevitably face a critical juncture that the existing solutions are futile in making a wider impact in society. Therefore, the question we need to ask ourselves is “How can social entrepreneurs effectively scale their impact to reach as many people and communities?” 

Through the experience of the conference and the presence of multiple inspiring and thought-provoking social entrepreneurs, you will walk away with two major lessons. First is that scale is not solely determined by organization’s size or budget, but by the change it helps to usher in. Second, collective impact is crucial in the process of creating change.

Delegates will range from students who are new to the idea of social enterprise to those who are deeply engaged in the field. They will hear from thought leaders who have created immense scalable change within their respective fields as well as fellow students who have started their own social ventures. Taking it one step further, delegates will also be challenged to think critically about how they can innovatively affect change and present their ideas under the mentorship of successful social entrepreneurs. 

Dresscode is smart casual! 

TICKETS ARE NOW FOR SALE! 
Get them at http://ow.ly/NwNC308yLPe 

All faculties are welcomed!! 

Early birds: Sold out 
UBC Students: $25 
Members: $20 
Non-UBC Students: $40 

SAVE THE DATE: Join us on MARCH 4th at The Nest for a day of impactful discussions, engaging panels, and insights on the possibilities of making impact at scale. 

Check out our website for more details: http://ubcsocialenterpriseconference.com/

event: BizTech & Riipen Present: UBC Tech Showcase
description:
Ready to land that summer internship? Want to meet industry professionals and gain more hands-on experience? Join BizTech at the UBC Tech Showcase.

The UBC Tech Showcase combines a job-fair-style event with Riipen challenges – small projects that include topics in marketing, sales, engineering, and project development. 

Some of Vancouver’s top tech firms post these challenges and award prizes for the top submissions (think second-round interviews, one-on-one time with executives, and other exclusive opportunities). 

UBC Tech Showcase 2017 Companies:
- Deloitte
- Traction on Demand
- Riipen
- BroadbandTV
... and more to be added soon!
 
The projects are augmented by the event itself, giving you a chance to meet the recruiters, get to know the company more and the understand their hiring process better.

In order to attend the UBC Tech Showcase, you must sign-up for at least one Riipen project by March 1st – projects are available now and will continually roll-out until the 1st.

Register for the event here: https://goo.gl/forms/kYcEoOfYWWz1Whmm2

Find a Riipen Project: 
https://www.ubcbiztech.com/ubc-tech-showcase

Event Details:
Date: Friday, March 3rd, 2017
Time: 4:00 - 6:00pm
Location: DLam Learning Labs (beneath Henry Angus & Triple O's)

The UBC Tech Showcase is free for BizTech Members. To become a member, register here: https://www.ubcbiztech.com/membership-2
